documentation:
This is an interface reference for Amazon Redshift Serverless. It contains documentation for one of the programming or command line interfaces you can use to manage Amazon Redshift Serverless.

Amazon Redshift Serverless automatically provisions data warehouse capacity and intelligently scales the underlying resources based on workload demands. Amazon Redshift Serverless adjusts capacity in seconds to deliver consistently high performance and simplified operations for even the most demanding and volatile workloads. Amazon Redshift Serverless lets you focus on using your data to acquire new insights for your business and customers.

To learn more about Amazon Redshift Serverless, see What is Amazon Redshift Serverless.

ConvertRecoveryPointToSnapshot.documentation: Converts a recovery point to a snapshot. For more information about recovery points and snapshots, see Working with snapshots and recovery points.
ConvertRecoveryPointToSnapshot.name: ConvertRecoveryPointToSnapshot

CreateEndpointAccess.documentation: Creates an Amazon Redshift Serverless managed VPC endpoint.
CreateEndpointAccess.name: CreateEndpointAccess

CreateNamespace.documentation: Creates a namespace in Amazon Redshift Serverless.
CreateNamespace.name: CreateNamespace

CreateSnapshot.documentation: Creates a snapshot of all databases in a namespace. For more information about snapshots, see Working with snapshots and recovery points.
CreateSnapshot.name: CreateSnapshot

CreateUsageLimit.documentation: Creates a usage limit for a specified Amazon Redshift Serverless usage type. The usage limit is identified by the returned usage limit identifier.
CreateUsageLimit.name: CreateUsageLimit

CreateWorkgroup.documentation: Creates an workgroup in Amazon Redshift Serverless.
CreateWorkgroup.name: CreateWorkgroup

DeleteEndpointAccess.documentation: Deletes an Amazon Redshift Serverless managed VPC endpoint.
DeleteEndpointAccess.name: DeleteEndpointAccess

DeleteNamespace.documentation: Deletes a namespace from Amazon Redshift Serverless. Before you delete the namespace, you can create a final snapshot that has all of the data within the namespace.
DeleteNamespace.name: DeleteNamespace

DeleteSnapshot.documentation: Deletes a snapshot from Amazon Redshift Serverless.
DeleteSnapshot.name: DeleteSnapshot

DeleteUsageLimit.documentation: Deletes a usage limit from Amazon Redshift Serverless.
DeleteUsageLimit.name: DeleteUsageLimit

GetCredentials.documentation:
Returns a database user name and temporary password with temporary authorization to log in to Amazon Redshift Serverless.

By default, the temporary credentials expire in 900 seconds. You can optionally specify a duration between 900 seconds (15 minutes) and 3600 seconds (60 minutes).

 <p> The Identity and Access Management (IAM) user or role that runs GetCredentials must have an IAM policy attached that allows access to all necessary actions and resources. </p> <p> If the <code>DbName</code> parameter is specified, the IAM policy must allow access to the resource dbname for the specified database name.</p>
GetCredentials.name: GetCredentials

GetEndpointAccess.documentation: Returns information, such as the name, about a VPC endpoint.
GetEndpointAccess.name: GetEndpointAccess

GetNamespace.documentation: Returns information about a namespace in Amazon Redshift Serverless.
GetNamespace.name: GetNamespace

ListEndpointAccess.documentation: Returns an array of EndpointAccess objects and relevant information.
ListEndpointAccess.name: ListEndpointAccess

ListNamespaces.documentation: Returns information about a list of specified namespaces.
ListNamespaces.name: ListNamespaces

ListTagsForResource.documentation: Lists the tags assigned to a resource.
ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource

ListUsageLimits.documentation: Lists all usage limits within Amazon Redshift Serverless.
ListUsageLimits.name: ListUsageLimits

ListWorkgroups.documentation: Returns information about a list of specified workgroups.
ListWorkgroups.name: ListWorkgroups

PutResourcePolicy.documentation: Creates or updates a resource policy. Currently, you can use policies to share snapshots across Amazon Web Services accounts.
PutResourcePolicy.name: PutResourcePolicy

RestoreFromRecoveryPoint.documentation: Restore the data from a recovery point.
RestoreFromRecoveryPoint.name: RestoreFromRecoveryPoint

TagResource.documentation: Assigns one or more tags to a resource.
TagResource.name: TagResource

UntagResource.documentation: Removes a tag or set of tags from a resource.
UntagResource.name: UntagResource

UpdateEndpointAccess.documentation: Updates an Amazon Redshift Serverless managed endpoint.
UpdateEndpointAccess.name: UpdateEndpointAccess

UpdateNamespace.documentation: Updates a namespace with the specified settings.
UpdateNamespace.name: UpdateNamespace

UpdateUsageLimit.documentation: Update a usage limit in Amazon Redshift Serverless. You can't update the usage type or period of a usage limit.
UpdateUsageLimit.name: UpdateUsageLimit

UpdateWorkgroup.documentation: Updates a workgroup with the specified configuration settings.
UpdateWorkgroup.name: UpdateWorkgroup

AccessDeniedException.documentation: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

ConfigParameter.documentation: An array of key-value pairs to set for advanced control over Amazon Redshift Serverless.

parameterKey.documentation: The key of the parameter. The options are datestyle, enable_user_activity_logging, query_group, search_path, and max_query_execution_time.

parameterValue.documentation: The value of the parameter to set.

recoveryPointId.documentation: The unique identifier of the recovery point.

snapshot.documentation: The snapshot converted from the recovery point.

endpointName.documentation: The name of the VPC endpoint. An endpoint name must contain 1-30 characters. Valid characters are A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and hyphen(-). The first character must be a letter. The name can't contain two consecutive hyphens or end with a hyphen.

subnetIds.documentation: The unique identifers of subnets from which Amazon Redshift Serverless chooses one to deploy a VPC endpoint.

vpcSecurityGroupIds.documentation: The unique identifiers of the security group that defines the ports, protocols, and sources for inbound traffic that you are authorizing into your endpoint.

workgroupName.documentation: The name of the workgroup to associate with the VPC endpoint.

adminUserPassword.documentation: The password of the administrator for the first database created in the namespace.

adminUsername.documentation: The username of the administrator for the first database created in the namespace.

dbName.documentation: The name of the first database created in the namespace.

defaultIamRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to set as a default in the namespace.

iamRoles.documentation: A list of IAM roles to associate with the namespace.

kmsKeyId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service key used to encrypt your data.

logExports.documentation: The types of logs the namespace can export. Available export types are userlog, connectionlog, and useractivitylog.

namespaceName.documentation: The namespace to create a snapshot for.

retentionPeriod.documentation: How long to retain the created snapshot.

amount.documentation: The limit amount. If time-based, this amount is in Redshift Processing Units (RPU) consumed per hour. If data-based, this amount is in terabytes (TB) of data transferred between Regions in cross-account sharing. The value must be a positive number.

breachAction.documentation: The action that Amazon Redshift Serverless takes when the limit is reached. The default is log.

period.documentation: The time period that the amount applies to. A weekly period begins on Sunday. The default is monthly.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon Redshift Serverless resource to create the usage limit for.

usageType.documentation: The type of Amazon Redshift Serverless usage to create a usage limit for.

baseCapacity.documentation: The base data warehouse capacity of the workgroup in Redshift Processing Units (RPUs).

configParameters.documentation: An array of parameters to set for more control over a serverless database. The options are datestyle, enable_user_activity_logging, query_group, search_path, and max_query_execution_time.

enhancedVpcRouting.documentation: The value that specifies whether to turn on enhanced virtual private cloud (VPC) routing, which forces Amazon Redshift Serverless to route traffic through your VPC instead of over the internet.

namespaceName.documentation: The name of the namespace to associate with the workgroup.

publiclyAccessible.documentation: A value that specifies whether the workgroup can be accessed from a public network.

securityGroupIds.documentation: An array of security group IDs to associate with the workgroup.

subnetIds.documentation: An array of VPC subnet IDs to associate with the workgroup.

endpointName.documentation: The name of the VPC endpoint to delete.

finalSnapshotName.documentation: The name of the snapshot to be created before the namespace is deleted.

finalSnapshotRetentionPeriod.documentation: How long to retain the final snapshot.

namespaceName.documentation: The name of the namespace to delete.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy to delete.

snapshotName.documentation: The name of the snapshot to be deleted.

usageLimitId.documentation: The unique identifier of the usage limit to delete.

workgroupName.documentation: The name of the workgroup to be deleted.

address.documentation: The DNS address of the VPC endpoint.

port.documentation: The port that Amazon Redshift Serverless listens on.

EndpointAccess.documentation: Information about an Amazon Redshift Serverless VPC endpoint.

endpointArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the VPC endpoint.

endpointCreateTime.documentation: The time that the endpoint was created.

port.documentation: The port number on which Amazon Redshift Serverless accepts incoming connections.

subnetIds.documentation: The unique identifier of subnets where Amazon Redshift Serverless choose to deploy the VPC endpoint.

vpcEndpoint.documentation: The connection endpoint for connecting to Amazon Redshift Serverless.

vpcSecurityGroups.documentation: The security groups associated with the endpoint.

workgroupName.documentation: The name of the workgroup associated with the endpoint.

dbName.documentation:
The name of the database to get temporary authorization to log on to.

Constraints:

  • Must be 1 to 64 alphanumeric characters or hyphens.

  • Must contain only lowercase letters, numbers, underscore, plus sign, period (dot), at symbol (@), or hyphen.

  • The first character must be a letter.

  • Must not contain a colon ( : ) or slash ( / ).

  • Cannot be a reserved word. A list of reserved words can be found in Reserved Words in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer Guide

durationSeconds.documentation: The number of seconds until the returned temporary password expires. The minimum is 900 seconds, and the maximum is 3600 seconds.

workgroupName.documentation: The name of the workgroup associated with the database.

dbPassword.documentation: A temporary password that authorizes the user name returned by DbUser to log on to the database DbName.

dbUser.documentation: A database user name that is authorized to log on to the database DbName using the password DbPassword. If the specified DbUser exists in the database, the new user name has the same database privileges as the the user named in DbUser. By default, the user is added to PUBLIC.

expiration.documentation: The date and time the password in DbPassword expires.

nextRefreshTime.documentation: The date and time of when the DbUser and DbPassword authorization refreshes.

endpointName.documentation: The name of the VPC endpoint to return information for.

namespaceName.documentation: The name of the namespace to retrieve information for.

recoveryPointId.documentation: The unique identifier of the recovery point to return information for.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to return.

ownerAccount.documentation: The owner Amazon Web Services account of a snapshot shared with another user.

snapshotArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot to return.

snapshotName.documentation: The name of the snapshot to return.

usageLimitId.documentation: The unique identifier of the usage limit to return information for.

workgroupName.documentation: The name of the workgroup to return information for.

InsufficientCapacityException.documentation: There is an insufficient capacity to perform the action.

InternalServerException.documentation: The request processing has failed because of an unknown error, exception or failure.

maxResults.documentation: An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return. You can use nextToken to get the next page of results.

nextToken.documentation: If your initial ListEndpointAccess operation returns a nextToken, you can include the returned nextToken in subsequent ListEndpointAccess operations, which returns results in the next page.

vpcId.documentation: The unique identifier of the virtual private cloud with access to Amazon Redshift Serverless.

workgroupName.documentation: The name of the workgroup associated with the VPC endpoint to return.

nextToken.documentation: When nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.

maxResults.documentation: An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return. You can use nextToken to get the next page of results.

nextToken.documentation: If your initial ListNamespaces operation returns a nextToken, you can include the returned nextToken in subsequent ListNamespaces operations, which returns results in the next page.

When nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.

endTime.documentation: The time when creation of the recovery point finished.

maxResults.documentation: An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return. You can use nextToken to get the next page of results.

namespaceName.documentation: The name of the namespace to list recovery points for.

nextToken.documentation: If your initial ListRecoveryPoints operation returns a nextToken, you can include the returned nextToken in subsequent ListRecoveryPoints operations, which returns results in the next page.

startTime.documentation: The time when the recovery point's creation was initiated.

nextToken.documentation: If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.

endTime.documentation: The timestamp showing when the snapshot creation finished.

maxResults.documentation: An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return. You can use nextToken to get the next page of results.

namespaceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the namespace from which to list all snapshots.

namespaceName.documentation: The namespace from which to list all snapshots.

nextToken.documentation: If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.

ownerAccount.documentation: The owner Amazon Web Services account of the snapshot.

startTime.documentation: The time when the creation of the snapshot was initiated.

nextToken.documentation: If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to list tags for.

tags.documentation: A map of the key-value pairs assigned to the resource.

maxResults.documentation: An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return. You can use nextToken to get the next page of results. The default is 100.

nextToken.documentation: If your initial ListUsageLimits operation returns a nextToken, you can include the returned nextToken in subsequent ListUsageLimits operations, which returns results in the next page.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the resource whose usage limits you want to list.

usageType.documentation: The Amazon Redshift Serverless feature whose limits you want to see.

nextToken.documentation: When nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page.

usageLimits.documentation: An array of returned usage limit objects.

maxResults.documentation: An optional parameter that specifies the maximum number of results to return. You can use nextToken to get the next page of results.

nextToken.documentation: If your initial ListWorkgroups operation returns a nextToken, you can include the returned nextToken in subsequent ListNamespaces operations, which returns results in the next page.
If nextToken is returned, there are more results available. The value of nextToken is a unique pagination token for each page. To retrieve the next page, make the call again using the returned token.

Namespace.documentation: A collection of database objects and users.

adminUsername.documentation: The username of the administrator for the first database created in the namespace.

creationDate.documentation: The date of when the namespace was created.

dbName.documentation: The name of the first database created in the namespace.

defaultIamRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to set as a default in the namespace.

iamRoles.documentation: A list of IAM roles to associate with the namespace.

kmsKeyId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service key used to encrypt your data.

logExports.documentation: The types of logs the namespace can export. Available export types are User log, Connection log, and User activity log.

namespaceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with a namespace.

namespaceName.documentation: The name of the namespace. Must be between 3-64 alphanumeric characters in lowercase, and it cannot be a reserved word. A list of reserved words can be found in Reserved Words in the Amazon Redshift Database Developer Guide.

NetworkInterface.documentation: Contains information about a network interface in an Amazon Redshift Serverless managed VPC endpoint.

networkInterfaceId.documentation: The unique identifier of the network interface.

privateIpAddress.documentation: The IPv4 address of the network interface within the subnet.

policy.documentation:
The policy to create or update. For example, the following policy grants a user authorization to restore a snapshot.

"{\"Version\": \"2012-10-17\", \"Statement\" : [{ \"Sid\": \"AllowUserRestoreFromSnapshot\", \"Principal\":{\"AWS\": [\"739247239426\"]}, \"Action\": [\"redshift-serverless:RestoreFromSnapshot\"] , \"Effect\": \"Allow\" }]}"

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the account to create or update a resource policy for.

resourcePolicy.documentation: The policy that was created or updated.

RecoveryPoint.documentation: The automatically created recovery point of a namespace. Recovery points are created every 30 minutes and kept for 24 hours.

namespaceName.documentation: The name of the namespace the recovery point is associated with.

recoveryPointCreateTime.documentation: The time the recovery point is created.

recoveryPointId.documentation: The unique identifier of the recovery point.

totalSizeInMegaBytes.documentation: The total size of the data in the recovery point in megabytes.

workgroupName.documentation: The name of the workgroup the recovery point is associated with.

resourceName.documentation: The name of the resource that could not be found.

ResourcePolicy.documentation: The resource policy object. Currently, you can use policies to share snapshots across Amazon Web Services accounts.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the policy.

namespaceName.documentation: The name of the namespace to restore data into.

recoveryPointId.documentation: The unique identifier of the recovery point to restore from.

workgroupName.documentation: The name of the workgroup used to restore data.

namespace.documentation: The namespace that data was restored into.

recoveryPointId.documentation: The unique identifier of the recovery point used for the restore.

namespaceName.documentation: The name of the namespace to restore the snapshot to.

ownerAccount.documentation: The Amazon Web Services account that owns the snapshot.

snapshotArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot to restore from.

snapshotName.documentation: The name of the snapshot to restore from.

workgroupName.documentation: The name of the workgroup used to restore the snapshot.

ownerAccount.documentation: The owner Amazon Web Services; account of the snapshot that was restored.

snapshotName.documentation: The name of the snapshot used to restore the namespace.

accountsWithProvisionedRestoreAccess.documentation: All of the Amazon Web Services accounts that have access to restore a snapshot to a provisioned cluster.

accountsWithRestoreAccess.documentation: All of the Amazon Web Services accounts that have access to restore a snapshot to a namespace.

actualIncrementalBackupSizeInMegaBytes.documentation: The size of the incremental backup in megabytes.

adminUsername.documentation: The username of the database within a snapshot.

backupProgressInMegaBytes.documentation: The size in megabytes of the data that has been backed up to a snapshot.

currentBackupRateInMegaBytesPerSecond.documentation: The rate at which data is backed up into a snapshot in megabytes per second.

elapsedTimeInSeconds.documentation: The amount of time it took to back up data into a snapshot.

estimatedSecondsToCompletion.documentation: The estimated amount of seconds until the snapshot completes backup.

kmsKeyId.documentation: The unique identifier of the KMS key used to encrypt the snapshot.

namespaceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the namespace the snapshot was created from.

ownerAccount.documentation: The owner Amazon Web Services; account of the snapshot.

snapshotArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the snapshot.

snapshotCreateTime.documentation: The timestamp of when the snapshot was created.

snapshotRemainingDays.documentation: The amount of days until the snapshot is deleted.

snapshotRetentionPeriod.documentation: The period of time, in days, of how long the snapshot is retained.

snapshotRetentionStartTime.documentation: The timestamp of when data within the snapshot started getting retained.

totalBackupSizeInMegaBytes.documentation: The total size, in megabytes, of how big the snapshot is.

key.documentation: The key to use in the tag.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to tag.

tags.documentation: The map of the key-value pairs used to tag the resource.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The request was denied due to request throttling.

TooManyTagsException.documentation: The request exceeded the number of tags allowed for a resource.

resourceName.documentation: The name of the resource that exceeded the number of tags allowed for a resource.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to remove tags from.

tagKeys.documentation: The tag or set of tags to remove from the resource.

endpointName.documentation: The name of the VPC endpoint to update.

vpcSecurityGroupIds.documentation: The list of VPC security groups associated with the endpoint after the endpoint is modified.

adminUserPassword.documentation: The password of the administrator for the first database created in the namespace.

adminUsername.documentation: The username of the administrator for the first database created in the namespace.

defaultIamRoleArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role to set as a default in the namespace.

iamRoles.documentation: A list of IAM roles to associate with the namespace.

kmsKeyId.documentation: The ID of the Amazon Web Services Key Management Service key used to encrypt your data.

logExports.documentation: The types of logs the namespace can export. The export types are userlog, connectionlog, and useractivitylog.

retentionPeriod.documentation: The new retention period of the snapshot.

amount.documentation: The new limit amount. For more information about this parameter.

breachAction.documentation: The new action that Amazon Redshift Serverless takes when the limit is reached.

usageLimitId.documentation: The identifier of the usage limit to update.

baseCapacity.documentation: The new base data warehouse capacity in Redshift Processing Units (RPUs).

configParameters.documentation: An array of parameters to set for advanced control over a database. The options are datestyle, enable_user_activity_logging, query_group, search_path, and max_query_execution_time.

enhancedVpcRouting.documentation: The value that specifies whether to turn on enhanced virtual private cloud (VPC) routing, which forces Amazon Redshift Serverless to route traffic through your VPC.

publiclyAccessible.documentation: A value that specifies whether the workgroup can be accessible from a public network.

securityGroupIds.documentation: An array of security group IDs to associate with the workgroup.

subnetIds.documentation: An array of VPC subnet IDs to associate with the workgroup.

workgroupName.documentation: The name of the workgroup to update.

amount.documentation: The limit amount. If time-based, this amount is in RPUs consumed per hour. If data-based, this amount is in terabytes (TB). The value must be a positive number.

breachAction.documentation: The action that Amazon Redshift Serverless takes when the limit is reached.

period.documentation: The time period that the amount applies to. A weekly period begins on Sunday. The default is monthly.

resourceArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the Amazon Redshift Serverless resource.

usageLimitArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource associated with the usage limit.

usageType.documentation: The Amazon Redshift Serverless feature to limit.

ValidationException.documentation: The input failed to satisfy the constraints specified by an AWS service.

VpcEndpoint.documentation: The connection endpoint for connecting to Amazon Redshift Serverless through the proxy.

networkInterfaces.documentation: One or more network interfaces of the endpoint. Also known as an interface endpoint.

vpcEndpointId.documentation: The connection endpoint ID for connecting to Amazon Redshift Serverless.

vpcId.documentation: The VPC identifier that the endpoint is associated with.

VpcSecurityGroupMembership.documentation: Describes the members of a VPC security group.

status.documentation: The status of the VPC security group.

vpcSecurityGroupId.documentation: The unique identifier of the VPC security group.

Workgroup.documentation: The collection of computing resources from which an endpoint is created.

baseCapacity.documentation: The base data warehouse capacity of the workgroup in Redshift Processing Units (RPUs).

configParameters.documentation: An array of parameters to set for finer control over a database. The options are datestyle, enable_user_activity_logging, query_group, search_path, and max_query_execution_time.

endpoint.documentation: The endpoint that is created from the workgroup.

enhancedVpcRouting.documentation: The value that specifies whether to enable enhanced virtual private cloud (VPC) routing, which forces Amazon Redshift Serverless to route traffic through your VPC.

namespaceName.documentation: The namespace the workgroup is associated with.

publiclyAccessible.documentation: A value that specifies whether the workgroup can be accessible from a public network

securityGroupIds.documentation: An array of security group IDs to associate with the workgroup.

subnetIds.documentation: An array of subnet IDs the workgroup is associated with.

workgroupArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that links to the workgroup.
